alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 12:30PM EST until February 27 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. For the Kentucky River...including Whitesburg, Hazard, Jackson, Oneida, Booneville, Heidelberg, Ravenna...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Heidelberg. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Sunday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 17.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall to 17.6 feet and begin rising again tomorrow evening. Further rises are expected Friday with the next round of expected rainfall. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued 11 PM on February, 23rd.
